00006 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00007 #pragma warning( disable : 4290 ) // suppress warning: C++ Exception Specification ignored
00008 #endif
00009 
00010 #include <string>
00011 
00012 // If the client doesn't specify these:
00013 static const int DEFAULT_OBJECTS_PER_PAGE = 4;  
00014 static const int DEFAULT_MAX_PAGES = 3;
00015 
00016 class OAException
00017 {
00018   public:
00019       // Possible exception codes
00020     enum OA_EXCEPTION 
00021     {
00022       E_NO_MEMORY,      // out of physical memory (operator new fails)
00023       E_NO_PAGES,       // out of logical memory (max pages has been reached)
00024       E_BAD_BOUNDARY,   // block address is on a page, but not on any block-boundary
00025       E_MULTIPLE_FREE,  // block has already been freed
00026       E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK // block has been corrupted (pad bytes have been overwritten)
00027     };
00028 
00029     OAException(OA_EXCEPTION ErrCode, const std::string& Message) : error_code_(ErrCode), message_(Message) {};
00030 
00031     virtual ~OAException() {
00032     }
00033 
00034     OA_EXCEPTION code(void) const { 
00035       return error_code_; 
00036     }
00037 
00038     virtual const char *what(void) const {
00039       return message_.c_str();
00040     }
00041   private:  
00042     OA_EXCEPTION error_code_;
00043     std::string message_;
00044 };
00045 
00046 // ObjectAllocator configuration parameters
00047 struct OAConfig
00048 {
00049   static const size_t BASIC_HEADER_SIZE = sizeof(unsigned) + 1; // allocation number + flags
00050   static const size_t EXTERNAL_HEADER_SIZE = sizeof(void*);     // just a pointer
00051 
00052   enum HBLOCK_TYPE{hbNone, hbBasic, hbExtended, hbExternal};
00053   struct HeaderBlockInfo
00054   {
00055     HBLOCK_TYPE type_;
00056     size_t size_;
00057     size_t additional_;
00058     HeaderBlockInfo(HBLOCK_TYPE type = hbNone, unsigned additional = 0) : type_(type), size_(0), additional_(additional)
00059     {
00060       if (type_ == hbBasic)
00061         size_ = BASIC_HEADER_SIZE;
00062       else if (type_ == hbExtended) // alloc # + use counter + flag byte + user-defined
00063         size_ = sizeof(unsigned int) + sizeof(unsigned short) + sizeof(char) + additional_;
00064       else if (type_ == hbExternal)
00065         size_ = EXTERNAL_HEADER_SIZE;
00066     };
00067   };
00068 
00069   OAConfig(bool UseCPPMemManager = false,
00070            unsigned ObjectsPerPage = DEFAULT_OBJECTS_PER_PAGE, 
00071            unsigned MaxPages = DEFAULT_MAX_PAGES, 
00072            bool DebugOn = false, 
00073            unsigned PadBytes = 0,
00074            const HeaderBlockInfo &HBInfo = HeaderBlockInfo(),
00075            unsigned Alignment = 0) : UseCPPMemManager_(UseCPPMemManager),
00076                                      ObjectsPerPage_(ObjectsPerPage), 
00077                                      MaxPages_(MaxPages), 
00078                                      DebugOn_(DebugOn), 
00079                                      PadBytes_(PadBytes),
00080                                      HBlockInfo_(HBInfo),
00081                                      Alignment_(Alignment)
00082   {
00083     HBlockInfo_ = HBInfo;
00084     LeftAlignSize_ = 0;  
00085     InterAlignSize_ = 0;
00086   }
00087 
00088   bool UseCPPMemManager_;   // by-pass the functionality of the OA and use new/delete
00089   unsigned ObjectsPerPage_; // number of objects on each page
00090   unsigned MaxPages_;       // maximum number of pages the OA can allocate (0=unlimited)
00091   bool DebugOn_;            // enable/disable debugging code (signatures, checks, etc.)
00092   unsigned PadBytes_;          // size of the left/right padding for each block
00093   HeaderBlockInfo HBlockInfo_; // size of the header for each block (0=no headers)
00094   unsigned Alignment_;      // address alignment of each block
00095 
00096   unsigned LeftAlignSize_;  // number of alignment bytes required to align first block
00097   unsigned InterAlignSize_; // number of alignment bytes required between remaining blocks
00098 };
00099 
00100 struct MemBlockInfo
00101 {
00102   bool in_use;        // Is the block free or in use?
00103   char *label;        // A dynamically allocated NUL-terminated string
00104   unsigned alloc_num; // The allocation number (count) of this block
00105 };
00106 
00107 class ObjectAllocator
00108 {
00109   public:
00110     ObjectAllocator(size_t ObjectSize, const OAConfig& config);
00111     void *Allocate() throw(OAException);
00112     void Free(void *Object) throw(OAException);
00113   private:
00114     OAConfig Config_;
00115     size_t ObjectSize_;
00116 };
